questions.question: 1. Let us consider V to be the total number of vertices and E to be the total number of edges in a tree. What is the time complexity of Breadth First Traversal in this tree?
2. What is the most appropriate data structure for Breadth First Traversal of a tree?

explanations.a: Ultimately the queue needs to be implemented from the linked list which increases overhead.
explanations.b: Correct, using queue will result in breadth first traversal
explanations.c: Incorrect, using stack will result in depth first traversal
explanations.d: Size of the array should be defined in the beginning and we can simulate a queue using array.
